Raw Institutional Statement: There is hereby created a New York State Council on Food Policy.

The Council shall consist of twenty-one members appointed by the Governor as follows: (a) the Commissioner of Agriculture and Markets, the Commissioner of Health, the Commissioner of the Office of Temporary Disability Assistance, the Commissioner of Education, the Commissioner of the Department of Economic Development and the Director of the Office for the Aging; (b) four members with experience and expertise related to agriculture, nutrition or food policy appointed on the recommendation of the legislative leaders, one each by the Temporary President of the Senate, the Speaker of the Assembly, the Minority Leader of the Senate, and the Minority Leader of the Assembly; (c) the Dean of the New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences; (d) one member representing farm organizations; (e) one member representing school food administrators; (f) one member representing consumers; (g) two members representing an organization that provides food assistance; (h) one member representing anti-hunger advocates; (i) one member who is a nutritionist; and (j) three members representing the food industry, including producers, distributors, processors or retailers who are residents of and work in the State of New York, at least one of whom produces organic food.
oBject: of twenty-one members appointed by the Governor as follows: (a) the Commissioner of Agriculture and Markets, the Commissioner of Health, the Commissioner of the Office of Temporary Disability Assistance, the Commissioner of Education, the Commissioner of the Department of Economic Development and the Director of the Office for the Aging; (b) four members with experience and expertise related to agriculture, nutrition or food policy appointed on the recommendation of the legislative leaders, one each by the Temporary President of the Senate, the Speaker of the Assembly, the Minority Leader of the Senate, and the Minority Leader of the Assembly; (c) the Dean of the New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences; (d) one member representing farm organizations; (e) one member representing school food administrators; (f) one member representing consumers; (g) two members representing an organization that provides food assistance; (h) one member representing anti-hunger advocates; (i) one member who is a nutritionist; and (j) three members representing the food industry, including producers, distributors, processors or retailers who are residents of and work in the State of New York, at least one of whom produces organic food

Raw Institutional Statement: The Commissioner of Agriculture and Markets shall serve as the Chairperson of the Council.

Raw Institutional Statement: and meet as frequently as business requires but shall meet at least twice each year

oBject: a quorum

Raw Institutional Statement: ...and an affirmative vote of the majority of the members of the Council shall be required for any action by the Council
oBject: an affirmative vote of the majority of the members of the Council

Raw Institutional Statement: The Council shall: (a) develop and recommend a food policy for the State which recognizes that it is in the best interests of the State to ensure the availability of an adequate supply of affordable, fresh, nutritious food to its residents;
oBject: a food policy for the State which recognizes that it is in the best interests of the State to ensure the availability of an adequate supply of affordable, fresh, nutritious food to its residents

Raw Institutional Statement: [The council shall] develop and recommend State policies to expand agricultural production, including locally-grown and organically-grown food;
oBject: State policies to expand agricultural production, including locally-grown and organically-grown food

Raw Institutional Statement: [The council shall] develop and recommend a strategic plan for implementation of the State food policy, including benchmarks and criteria for measuring progress in achieving State food policy objectives;
oBject: a strategic plan for implementation of the State food policy, including benchmarks and criteria for measuring progress in achieving State food policy objectives

Raw Institutional Statement: [The council shall] offer comments on State regulations, legislation and budget proposals in the area of food policy, to ensure a coordinated and comprehensive inter-agency approach to food policy issues.
oBject: comments on State regulations, legislation and budget proposals in the area of food policy, to ensure a coordinated and comprehensive inter-agency approach to food policy issues.

Raw Institutional Statement: The Council shall issue a written report on the first day of December each year on: (a) the activities of the Council during the preceding year; (b) recommended food policies for the State; (c) recommended changes to the strategic plan; (d) an account of the progress made in achieving the goals of the Council; and (e) actions which are necessary to implement the recommendations of the Council and effectuate the purposes of this Order.
oBject: a written report on: (a) the activities of the Council during the preceding year; (b) recommended food policies for the State; (c) recommended changes to the strategic plan; (d) an account of the progress made in achieving the goals of the Council; and (e) actions which are necessary to implement the recommendations of the Council and effectuate the purposes of this Order
Condition: on the first day of December each year
